details.title: COVID-19 HIGHLIGHTS | With over 16000 cases, Maharashtra records highest single-day spike
details.content: Maharashtra on Saturday reported a single-day highest spike of 16,867 coronavirus cases which pushed its case tally to 7,64,281, the state health department said. With 328 new fatalities, the death toll due to the pandemic reached 24,103, it said in a release. The earlier highest one-day increase in number of patients was 14,888 on August 26. There are 1,85,131 active cases. 11,541 patients were discharged during the day, taking total recoveries to 5,54,711. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Delhi Metro to resume services from September 7 in calibrated manner: DMRC
details.content: "As per the latest guidelines issued by the Ministry of Home Affairs under Unlock-4, the Delhi Metro will be resuming its services for public from September 7 onwards in a calibrated manner," the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) said in a statement. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: After Delhi, now Kochi Metro to resume services
details.content:
• As part of Unlock 4 guidelines by Centre, Kochi Metro services to resume operations from September 7.
  • In the first phase, the service will run at intervals of 20 minutes from 7 am to 8 pm.
  • The service is in full compliance with COVID-19 standards: Kochi Metro Rail Limited.
  • The train will stop for 20 seconds at each station, and open the doors of the train in this time for air circulation.
  • Seats for passengers are marked inside the train, keeping the social distance: KMRL.

The recovery rate has increased to 76.61 per cent while the COVID-19 case fatality rate has further declined to 1.79 per cent. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Livelihoods robbed during lockdown, band artists look for work on last Ganesh immersion day
details.content: After the lockdown came into force in March, many band artists in Maharashtra's Aurangabad and Nanded districts had to leave their profession as they did not get any bookings for playing instruments since people cancelled or postponed wedding ceremonies in the last few months. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Ladakh records four more COVID-19 deaths, toll now 32
details.content:
• Ladakh has reported four more coronavirus-related deaths, taking the total number of fatalities due to the disease to 32 in the Union Territory, officials said on Sunday.
  • Two deaths each linked to COVID-19 were reported from Kargil and Leh districts on Saturday, the officials said. The death toll comprises 20 fatalities in Kargil and 12 in Leh.
  • On Saturday, the officials said 41 fresh COVID-19 cases were detected in Leh and 22 in Kargil district.
  • Ladakh has recorded 2,603 cases of the novel coronavirus since the outbreak of the pandemic in March.
  • The officials said while 1,745 patients have recovered from the infection and discharged from hospitals, 826 cases are still active in the twin districts, 496 in Leh and 330 in Kargil.

details.title: COVID-19: IIT Bhubaneswar starts new academic year through online mode
details.content: Speaking on the occasion, its Director Prof R V Raja Kumar said, "We could start the new academic year on time and we are now left with the only challenge of commencing the classes for fresh and 2020-21 batch of B Tech students." (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Delhi Metro's new guidelines: All you need to know
details.content:
• Masks, smart cards will be mandatory for passengers after the services reopen from September 7. Delhi government's new guidelines list severe restrictions lncluding ban on tokens for the train ride and limited passengers in coaches.
  • The air conditioning system won't be operational to ensure fresh air inside coaches. Trains will not stop at all metro stations as the services will be resumed in phasewise manner.
  • All the safety rules will be strictly observed at stations, including social distancing and thermal checking. Hand sanitiser will also be provided.
  • Stations in containment zones will remain shut. Other than those, there will be another list of stations which won't be operational now and a list of these will be made available to public, transport minister Kailash Gahlot said on Sunday.

details.title: Driving change: Women e-rickshaw drivers hit by pandemic but stay the empowerment course
details.content: "I am ready to do all kinds of odd jobs temporarily to make money, but there is no way I am selling my rickshaw," said Sima Khan, a doughty Lucknow-based woman who went from being homemaker to entrepreneur. She is among the scores of women across the country who bought e-rickshaws through support centres in their city by somehow managing the money for down payments and have been earning a living and also paying their EMIs. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Haryana revokes earlier order directing shops, malls to remain shut on Mondays, Tuesdays
details.content:
"In unlock 4.0, the central government has not given any rights to the states to impose lockdown and that is why Haryana has taken back its orders dated August 28 directing all the markets to remain shut on Mondays and Tuesdays," Vij said on Twitter. The August 28 order was issued by the then Haryana chief secretary Keshni Anand Arora who is also the Haryana State Executive Committee states.

details.title: Global coronavirus cases top 25 million; US leads count with 5.9 million cases
details.content: The real number of people infected by the virus around the world is believed to be much higher - perhaps 10 times higher in the US, according to the Centre for Disease Control and Prevention - given testing limitations and the many mild cases that have gone unreported or unrecognized, reports Associated Press.

details.title: Recoveries in India crosses 27 lakh-mark
details.content: India's COVID19 recoveries today crossed 27 lakhs. With the recovery of 64,935 cases in the last 24 hours, recoveries in India today exceeded active cases by 3.55 times. India's recovery rate improved to 76.61% while Case Fatality Rate dipped to 1.79% today: Ministry of Health

details.title: Number of COVID-19 tests conducted goes past 4.14 crore in India: Health ministry
details.content:
The exponential jump in the testing capacity and the number of tests has resulted in an upsurge in the Tests Per Million to 30,044 as on date, it highlighted. With a record 10,55,027 tests conducted on Saturday, the country has further strengthened the national diagnostic capacity of testing more than 10 lakh samples for COVID-19 on a daily basis.

FULL REPORT HERE

details.title: BJP Karnataka state president tests positive for COVID-19
details.content: BJP Karnataka chief Nalinkumar Kateel took to Twitter to announce his COVID status. "I was hospitalised on the advice of a doctor even though there were no symptoms. I appeal to all who came in contact with me to be careful," Kateel said.

details.content: Chhattisgarh CM instructs district collectors to arrange for free transport for aspirants appearing for NEET-JEE exams to reach examination centres. Buses etc. to be arranged in every district on basis of no. of aspirants. Permission to travel in the vehicle with admit card only.

details.title: COVID-19: Lata Mangeshkar, family safe as BMC seals Prabhu Kunj building
details.content:
"11 COVID-19 positive cases have been found in Prabhu Kunj building so for the protection of the people we have sealed that building," said a BMC official. The official also said a lot of residents are elderly people in the building, so keeping the safety of these people in mind, it has been sealed." The officer also confirmed that the 90-year-old singer is completely fine and she was never in touch with the 11 people who were tested positive for COVID-19.

FULL REPORT HERE

TN CM EPS extends lockdown period for one month till September 30; without e-Pass people can travel across the State @xpresstn @NewIndianXpress

Details of relaxations for extended lockdown period in TN @xpresstn @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/aqnb0Vlifi

— T Muruganandham (@muruga_TNIE) August 30, 2020

details.title: Lockdown restrictions eased further in TN
details.content:
• All temples in Tamil Nadu opened for public worship; In Chennai, MTC buses can ply from September 1; Metro Rail will be operated from September 7.
  • Shopping malls, all show rooms, big format stores can function with 100 percent employees; all shops will be allowed to be open till 8 pm; all factories and IT companies can function with 100 percent employees.
  • Hotels, resorts, recreation clubs can function; parks and playgrounds will opened; govt offices will start functioning with 100 percent employees from September 30
  • Banks and allied institutions can function with 100 percent employees; film shooting can be done with a ceiling of 75 employees; complete lockdown on Sundays WILL NOT be there from September 1
  • Religious gatherings, social, political, cultural, eductional and other meetings and processions will remain banned till September 30.
